title: Great
text: My 2 grandchildren absolutely loved this gift.

title: Awesome Gaming Mouse
text: I've been using this mouse for a couple of years now, and am mostly happy with it. It's comfortable and very responsive. I especially like the scroll wheel. One minor frustration is the extra buttons near where you place your thumb. All too often I end up accidentally bumping one of those buttons. But otherwise it's my go-to mouse for my PC, and when it dies someday I will likely buy another one.

title: Excellent gaming / everyday mouse
text:
I bought this mouse without reading many of the reviews. I searched for "silent mouse" and followed a trail of products until I landed on this Logitech G502 HERO mouse. I don't know if it was advertised as quiet or silent, but it doesn't matter too much at this point. The mouse is very well crafted, and the weights that are provided allow you to customize how heavy the mouse is. I didn't think this would make a big difference, but it truly does. The weight keeps the mouse parallel to the desk surface but doesn't seem to inhibit movement at all. It's a fantastic feeling. Additionally, the mouse is wired, which eliminates having to worry about batteries or latency with a wireless connection.
I use this mouse for gaming and for everyday office use, but gamers who are more "serious" about their gaming will find all the bells and whistles needed. There are around 10 buttons on this mouse, and the software that is downloaded from the Logitech website makes setting up the functions very easy.
I believe this mouse was under $40 or $50 dollars when I bought it, and it is worth every penny in my opinion.
(By the way, it is not a quiet or silent mouse, but the clicks don't make much more noise than you'd expect of a high quality mouse.)

title: 2 for 2, failed buttons. Just get a Deathadder
text:
I wanted to like this mouse. I like the position of the buttons (particularly the toggle DPI that lets you have a "snipe" button - more mice need that) and the general shape of the mouse, but it's just got so many problems, including abysmal build quality (which is shocking for logitech)

For starters, it's weirdly draggy and a bit heavy, even wired and with zero weights in it. I can't see anyone wanting to add more of the included weights - the point of this kind of mouse is to start LIGHT and let you tune it, not start heavy and let you make it worse. Genuinely heavier than my full size WIRELESS teknet mouse that I use for my media PC.

The feet lasted okay, they're starting to feel worn after a year of use on an aluminum banshee pad mousepad (I usually got about 2-3 years out of a set of feet on a Razer Deathadder) And they're very sensitive to picking up schmutz. Replacement feet are not readily found, you're gonna be using teflon tape. The combination of really meh feet and really heavy/draggy weight makes the mouse wildly imprecise after only a couple months. Even with teflon tape over the feet, I still can't make a "clean" drag across my mousepad with a smooth cursor movement. Not even sure it would when it was new. The aforementioned teknet mouse still absolutely glides after years. I think it's just because the 502 has SIX absolutely gigantic pads, and other mice I use tend to have 3 or 4 much smaller feet at most, which keeps the inherent friction lower.

Cord is okay if used with a mouse bungie.

The scroll wheel is abysmal. It has a side/side rock, which is already not good for a proper gaming mouse (they all have a habit of mis-registering mouse 3 clicks) but this is easily the worst I've ever experienced. I am used to the design, but this one is so bad and vague that I had to straight up disable the rocker, so now I only get about 15% of my middle clicks mis-sensed. The ability to unlock a scroll wheel is nice when I have to turbo scroll through a 300 page document, but again, in GAMING practice, is just one more way the scroll wheel feels incredibly vague and inaccurate.

mouse 4 is just set too far back. You have to press it with the knuckle of your thumb, which requires an incredibly awkward "palm pinch". If you use all the mouse buttons in a game, you're going to hate this thing so much.

And the thing is INCREDIBLY fragile. My first one's left click broke just sliding off my chair onto carpet, the whole mouse button itself sheared off. The second one's L2 switch itself is now failing, as it registers right click but doesn't register HOLDING it. After only a year, this is appalling. If you play MMO's, this makes steering an absolute nightmare. If you play FPS games, right click iron sight/scope becomes agony.

And there's something about this mouse that gives me really sweaty palms, which is weird because I have a kind of hybrid palm/fingertip grip that keeps my palm usually hovering just above the mouse

My deathadder was only replaced by this mouse because I suspected the skin flakes embedded in the chassis had evolved a new form of life. This one is getting hucked in the garbage because it fell to pieces in a little over a year and a half. I am staying away from Logitech for a few years after two absolutely atrocious peripherals and going back to the good old iron duke of a Razer Deathadder.

title: Excelente
text: Excelente

title: Exceeded expectations.
text: This is what it is like to buy a name-brand mouse!  Yowzers...Totally different than Redragon or Uhuru.  On its own it has a decent feel, but it absolutely needs some weight to make it comfortable.  DPI is a whole other league than I was expecting, too.  I feel like I have actual control and the cursor jumps to wherever I want it.  Customizable buttons, mild use of RGB....fantastic ergonomics...It's a gaming mouse for an adult.

title: This is the number 1 mouse used by pro-gamers pre wireless for a reason
text: I love this most and accompanying software. It is easy to setup and customize for multiple applications and users. It glides smoothly and can adjust weight for your preference. I added all weights for high dpi but precision control. I am using this mouse not just for gaming but also productivity as you can create customer profiles with applications like photoshop and customize macros as short custom keys like undo or deselect. and currently it is on sale. Original price when this was released was 150.00 I believe so 40.00 is an amazing price.

title: The old one was better
text: The older G502 was better in some ways. The new one only gets 4 stars because they did away with the nylon sleeved cable, I can see this being an issue later on as I see it wearing over time. Everything else is pretty much the same, time will only tell.

title: Excellent hardware with broken software support, use Logitech's legacy software
text:
Excellent mouse, as advertised with no hardware issues.

However, Logitech's G Hub software is a dumpster fire of an application. Logitech pushes updates that break the app itself or hardware functionality (like not registering left clicks). Background cpu usage is upwards of 15% on a Ryzen 3600 system. G Hub feels like an alpha release and Logitech hasn't be able to improve stability or app performance since they released G Hub back in February 2019. Yes, thats 7 months of garbage software support for their flagship hardware products. Save yourself the pain and DO NOT DOWNLOAD G HUB.

The fix is to use the legacy 'Logitech Gaming Software' which is still available and does include support for the 502 Hero. I'm using the LGS 9.02.65 release hosted on TechSpot and have no issues. LGS supports button rebinding as well as LED color control in a reliable fashion, unlike G Hub.

This would be an easy 5 star review but in 2019 I should not be forced to use legacy software to ensure my hardware functions properly.

title: Great mouse
text: Set up was easy. Smooth tracking. Great feeling mouse in hand. Love it.

title: Lasted less than a year.
text: Double click on right mouse button, and no feedback click on release of left mouse button in less than a year. This is a low quality copy of the proteus model that gave me 3 years of use before needing to be replaced. Skip this and get the proteus instead.

title: Great mouse, with some features I didn't know about
text: Being able to toggle the DPI sensitivity on the fly, adjust the mouse 'roller' wheel, and other things were unexpected. Overall, very happy with this mouse.

title: Great for gaming

title: Good match for CORSAIR K70 RGB MK.2 RAPIDFIRE
text: This plus the CORSAIR K70 RGB MK.2 RAPIDFIRE are going to make any gamer happy.  You can plug the mouse into the back of the Rapidfire keyboard and cut down on the wire cluster.  I'm not a gamer, but have many of the same needs as I am editing digital photos in Lightroom/ON1/Luminar/Photoshop.  I can program the mouse to enable some of my highly used editing keystrokes, and match that with the keyboard.  My son, who is a gamer, keeps trying to steal both the keyboard and mouse . . . I told him to buy his own :D

I did not like the scroll wheel, it feels slippery.
I don't know if this is a defective mouse?
I'm returning it.

title: It's Nice having a GOOD mouse
text: I love so much about this mouse. The weights are probably my favorite part, being able to adjust that per game and need is amazing. I do wish I had one-two more (max no more please) buttons on the side for tying to macros and what have you, but this is an excellent mouse without breaking the bank. I love the ability to have rough or loose scrolling on the wheel. Easy to clean too (games, clean yo dang mice, human hands be gross!)

title: great
text: adjustable, pinpoint, great quality

title: Good but not great
text:
Pros:
Solid sensor, good programmable button options, software worked well on Windows 10 and Mac OSX.
Wired, so no dealing with batteries, chargers, connections, or lag. The rubber on the side grips feels good.
Settings can be saved to onboard memory, so the color and speed and button tweaks work on any machine, not just ones with the driver and your profile installed, unlike Razor.

Cons:
Feels light/cheap even with the added weights, like every piece of plastic was as thin as they could make it without it shattering during shipping.

The scroll wheel wobbles just slightly left and right (it is supposed to move left right when pushed, but I mean just by moving the mouse on the desk, the wheel flops a 1/2 millimeter back and forth, causing a distracting rattle. It does it less when you turn off freewheel and use clicky wheel, but it's still audible there, too.

Some settings don't seem to be editable in onboard memory, you have to download the profile, update it there, then re-upload it. Wouldn't be a big deal, but you can't even view the button customizations without downloading, it just tells you how many buttons were programmed, not what they do.

Not built for large hands - feels 80% of normal size. For example my thumb can't rest in the thumb slot below the two side buttons; with my thumb resting against the bottom of the groove, the top of my thumb is still against the two top buttons, not nestled into the recess below them.

title: From bad to good!!!
text: EDITED & REVISITED after further testing. My previous review bashed this mouse due to poor mouse quality, but upon further investigation the mouse CORD was getting snagged ever so slightly on my desk. This mouse was great for fps gaming. Locks in DPI perfectly for accurate aiming. I tested a few other mice after this one and this one is the most accurate and consistent. BUY IT

title: I love this gaming mouse
text: This a great gaming mouse, I got it to replace my old Logitech G500, and it's a perfect replacement.  Highly recommended:)

I'm a power user, gamer, programmer, creator and I need something that moves fast, doesn't need to be recharged, is programmable and well pretty colors I can manipulate are also appreciated.  Seriously though, this mouse glides so nicely, and I absolutely love the scroll lock toggle!

title: Simple and Now Affordable
text:
I mean it's just the simplest best Logitech mouse ever it has the weights something I always liked. The G-Hub software is amazing I'm able to have profiles on the mouse and take it to work and then on my dual boot system one of the windows operating systems I have g-hub installed and it uses the onboard memory so I can switch between the profiles I'm used to. Then on my gaming operating system I force it to use the software instead of the onboard so I can customize it just for gaming and not accidentally switch between profiles.

It's smooth as butter it lasts a good long time Make sure the cord doesn't rub against the back of your keyboard tray it'll eventually fray the fabric over time it's happened with all the mice that I've ever owned it's not about this one I just use a little bit of duct tape and tuck it up against the bottom of the desk.

RGB is cool not obnoxious but you can see it. Highly customizable not too many buttons but just enough.

There's this like sniper button the precise button for your thumb it like lowers your DPI when you hold it Don't even use that for lowering your DPI Free that up for something it's a game changer having three thumb buttons.

title: Worked great until the left mouse button blew up (double click issue)
text: The mouse was great until the double click issue happened.  Now this mouse is trash.  I had it for 15 months and now it has to get thrown out.  I would look for something else before buying this one or any other Logitech mouse.

title: Everyone in the house has one
text:
I use one of these at work and at home. After burning through 2x razor naga trinities (primary and secondary button fatigue), I decided to give these a try. While I miss the 7 button radial button arrangement, with this mouse, I only lost 1 button, technically. Logitech software is easy enough to use and you don't need an account to use it, which is nice. It's easy enough to configure all buttons the way you want them. The scroll wheel lock and weights are by far the best features. Best of all, it's outlived both the trinities I had.
Highly recommend for business, personal, and gaming use.

title: Great mouse - for the first year
text: This is a great mouse. Very responsive and comfortable. But expect to have to buy a new one every year because the switches for the left and right click wear out and start double clicking shortly after a year of normal use.  Mine actually started having issues before the warranty ran out, but Logitech doesn't make it easy to file a warranty claim.  Eventually got to file a claim which they make you verify the issue by clicking on a box on a site they host. Issue is, you can only click a certain number of times before it's deemed defective or not. Mine was having an issue, but not reliably enough to be caught by their check so I wasn't able to exchange the mouse. The problem kept getting worse and worse and now that the mouse is out of warranty it's very frustrating to use and there's nothing I can do about it.

title: Right Click is not working properly after a year.
text: Great mouse overall, not sure if this is a QA oversight or what. The right click does not fully register makes it a pain when "aiming down sights" in any FPS game. Love the mouse overall, just wish it would made it past a year of gaming.

title: wasnt sure
text: I wasn't sure i would like this mouse. it looks kinda like a space ship so was worried a bit. I had a corsair glave for years and really liked it and was worried that this smaller mouse would be hard for me to get used to. after about 4 hours I started to get used to and love the mouse. As i continue to use it i have only found one issue I often find the scroll wheel when unlocked zoom in a out in games (some games do different things just took one for example) so I only unlock it to scroll down where i lock it again. really like the mouse wish I had gotten the wireless version honestly

text: My son is a computer gamer and he absolutely loves this mouse.  Its exactly what he expected for the price and is very happy.  No complaints and would purchase this item again if needed.

title: 50% don't work in MY experience
text:
Ordered up a replacement mouse for this same model that I've had for quite awhile.
Eventually it got all glitchy & started falling apart.
When Logitech's official "fix" of 'smacking it on your desk' no longer worked, I caved & bought a new one.

The replacement came quickly and worked for exactly 1 day. It also didn't have a braided cord. WTH? They should have a braided cord, so that was sketch.
I ordered a replacement for the new broken mouse. It arrived quickly, & works just fine, so far. This one has a braided cord. Makes me wonder if the first mouse I got off Amazon was either a refurbished or counterfeit. Who knows? Doesn't really matter to me anymore, I've returned it.

Oh yeah, we had Covid & I requested a return delay, considering the nature of the item, & the fact that I'd touched all up on it. I was denied!! Blew me away.
So, I Lysoled it, bagged it up, set it in the trunk of my car for 2 days hoping the heat would kill the virus, then asked a Covid negative family member to take it to UPS for me.

Complete BS, in my opinion. But, hey, all you can do is make it as safe as possible if the people you're dealing with say they don't care & want it back on the original timeline, no matter what! Not cool, I wasn't asking to keep it...
This whole situation really has me re-thinking my use of Amazon. It ain't what it used to be.

title: Bad scroll wheel. A bit awkward to use.
text: Mouse naturally sits toward the tips of my fingers. Does not nest into my palm very well. Scroll wheel quit working completely after 2.5 weeks of use. Scroll wheel sits too far back toward my palm. I feel the scroll wheel should be positioned closer to the end of the finger. I have returned the mouse and re-ordered a new one. I am hoping that this is not a common defect. I will update with any news of the replacement.

title: Left and right button click issue after 6 months
text: Great features and ergonomics, but the infamous mouse clicking issue began after 6 months of use.  I first noticed that the right mouse button was releasing prematurely during right-click and drag about 50% of the time.  Now the left button is double-clicking on a single click 30-50% of the time.  I'm now using my 15-year old Logitech basic mouse that still works flawlessly.

title: Good quality mouse
text: Great mouse for the cost. I most play mmo's and I love the extra buttons for hotkeys. I havent had any of the double clicking issues like others have mentioned.

title: I'd say stay away. I'm glad I didn't write my review on week one.
text: All the things are great. Buttons, weights, everything. I loved this mouse, and told many people about it. I had a Razor before this. For $50 in 2008, the Razor lasted me 11 years. This mouse here, the "Hero", lasted not even a year and a half. The left button, the most important button, screws up all the time. I can't even click and drag. Apparently, this is an issue with this mouse in particular. Look it up before you buy it, it wouldn't hurt.

text:
Doing a computer rebuild and wanted to treat myself to a "gaming" mouse. This one looks nice, seems well made and the price was right.
As soon as I got into a game, WZ2 here, I immediate realize, this was a BIG mistake. I could not help myself from hitting the mouse buttons with my thumb and bringing up the map and other things. No Bueno!
Returned it and got the G305, which is more inline with the type of mouse I'm use to.

title: Lags all the time for a second or more
text: This mouse is total garbage. Only a few months after purchase it's already a total POS that lags all the time. If you don't run G-hub, any changes you make like lighting config won't stay with the mouse. So you are forced to run their software, which forces you to opt in to certain things, there is no opt-out button on the installer. So total privacy failure.

title: Can endure frustrations
text: Angrily I've thrown this mouse a few times now. Not because of the mouse itself, but because I get mad at the games I play. This mouse is the first mouse I've owned that can really take a beating. Razer mice are expensive and they feel cheaply made in comparison. I'm very happy with this purchase and I'd recommend it to anyone who is in the market for a new mouse.

title: Best while it lasted???
text:
This mouse is fantastic. It's sturdy, it's comfortable, the laser is amazing and never skips around. If it's too expensive for you just go with the G203. I believe they have the same tech on the inside but just fewer bells and whistles. I own both and they are both fantastic.

Edit to review:
After just a few months, both right and left mouse clickers are malfunctioning. The left one double clicks almost every time I click it (already attempted several "fixes" but it appears to be the hardware as nothing the all knowing google has to suggest has worked) and the left one will not maintain a click when I hold it down (for games such as Call of Duty this is detrimental as I am unable to maintain a zoom in with scopes).

Because of this, I am lowering my 5-star review to 2 stars. This should happen. I would expect this type of issue from some off brand Chinese sweat-shop mouse. I expect much more from Logitech.

title: Functions OK but bad software and cheap feel
text:
The mouse functions well. However, the buttons are loose and feel cheap. The software programming is unnecessarily complicated and should work more like the Options utility for the non-gaming mice. Also, the settings are unreliable and the device & software combo doesn’t save programming across devices or platforms.

Lastly the device is NOT Apple Macintosh mobile compatible as the mouse is missing a USB-C adapter.

title: Epic
text:
I just bought a Logitech Mechanical Keyboard a few weeks ago along with one of the new Ergo trackballs. I love both, and they are just amazing. However the trackball is tremendous for work, not so tremendous for gaming. I've not used a high end gaming mouse and was really excited about this.

First, it looks great. It matches the mechanical keyboards they make, or even most of the competitors. It really has the looks department down. At first I found it a little too light to the point it almost felt flimsy but then I used the weights that come with it and you get several of them so you can find the perfect balance you want. It's excellent.

Feature wise, it lets you do so much but I think if you're used to gaming mice, it's probably not as big of a deal for you as it was for me. The fact you can change the buttons and build small routines is very cool but I know that's been available for a while.

What stands out though is both the responsiveness (which is tremendous) and the level of control and precision) . The scroll feature allows you to refine scrolling in conjunction with the other movement and it all 'just works'.

Yes, it's worth every penny and then some. I love many Logitech products, this is a perfect reason why.

title: Best mouse you can buy for the price

It just feels so comfortable. The clicks are satisfying and it can be pretty fast. The only thing I don't like is the scroll wheel. text: After having a Magic Eagle mouse for about 5 years, I replaced it with this. I am a PC gamer, but didn't want all the fancy bells and whistles that come with others. Whereas this does have weights to help with controllability, I found that using it straight of the box as it, was perfect. It has excellent response time (I usually play snipers) and the DPI is customizable. If you use the Logitech software, you can customize the colors with it to match your set up with no problem. title: Cool mouse bad materials

title: There is no better mouse
text:
This is my second g502. I want to say how amazing that is. I almost never buy the same product twice. Checking my history, I got the last one 5 years ago, and it survived daily use, and heavy gaming. Eventually the left click began to stick and randomly release while holding. 5 years though to me is a good amount of time and use to get out of anything you use daily.

The scroll wheel and the weight of this mouse are what I love most. The scroll wheel can be unlocked and sound freely, making reading long documents and scrolling through things a breeze. The weight suits my use of a mouse.

There are two schools of thought when it comes to gaming mice. Some prefer an ultralight mouse suited to moving a lot. This is what the younger generation seems to be gravitating towards. I don't like to move my arm or wrist too much during prolonged use because this leads to carpal tunnel and wrist strain. The G502 is NOT an ultralight.

The second school is made up of heavy mice, intentionally weighted down. These mice have a much higher DPI than the first kind of mouse, leading to a much more sensitive mouse. Users preferring this style use micro movements with their fingertips to navigate a PC. It takes a while to get used to DPI above 20k, but once you do you'll wonder how you lived without.

Anyways, it's rare to see a product that is as consistently awesome as this one is, and I hope they never stop making them.

title: Muy buen producto
text: Excelente

title: Mouse click issue
text: Had this mouse for about a year, good mouse. But then the click problems started showing up. You click and drag on text and it stops because the mouse is doing another click. You play a game and you'll click once but you'll get twice. You'll be in a tense gaming moment and click just in time but nothing happens because it didn't click. It's definitely the mouse, I used the software to switch the left click and right click buttons, a few weeks later, the right click button started having problems too.

title: Probably a little fancier than most people need
text:
I play some games online and I was looking for a mouse that had a 3rd and maybe a 4th button so I could fire some preset combinations of weapons off without using the keyboard. This works great for that and has more buttons that I probably would ever use, but if you wanted 5th and 6th and 7th button options, it's here.

The mouse is a little big in my hand, I would have preferred it to be a bit smaller to be totally comfortable.

Other than that it's just a regular mouse. No issues with it at all and it does what you expect it to do.

title: Great mouse, poor software
text:
I really like this mouse. I added all the included weights and it gives the mouse a very solid feel.
It's comfortable and well designed.

I hooked up to my existing Logitech Gaming Software and replaced my old mouse importing the custom profiles perfectly.
All I needed to do was adjust the DPI to my liking.

But I also purchased a new keyboard and had to install the G Hub software because the the Gaming Software was just too old and didn't support the new kb. The G Hub wares replaces the old Gaming Software and this is where the problems started. The G Hub software is horrible.
Seriously, just do a quick Google search and you'll see a LOT of complaints about it.

It took all day to figure it out and create new profiles and make it recognize games. No help could be found on the Logitech site and Google offered little help.
Eventually I was able to make everything work as I wanted but it was a frustrating day.

Final comment, this mouse is great and I recommend it. But the G Hub software should be avoided if you can.
If you do not already own Logitech gear, look elsewhere.

title: Scroll wheels issues
text: Avoid this mouse for gaming. It has a defect with the scroll wheel that will have you constantly switching weapons in games like Call of Duty Warzone. It’s super annoying and unusable. Check the internet this is a common issues for this mouse. Wish I’d done more research before buying.

title: Great mouse for the price.
text: Ultimately, I'm very satisfied with this mouse.  My number one complaint is that the scroll wheel isn't rubberized and is metal, so my fingertip tends to slide on it too easily (especially on cold/dry days).  However, I looooove the de-click button.  That almost makes up for the slippery wheel.  Ergonomically, it's so-so.  Feels a little small in my hand and slightly awkward.  I tend to accidentally click the precision buttons when trying to click primary.  But all-in-all I'm pretty pleased with it.

title: Don't expect the drivers to work.
text:
If you really want to use all those extra buttons and features of this mouse, too bad. The drivers have gotten progressively worse and worse and now they pretty much never work. Every update seems to make them less and less stable.
After an hour or so of use all the mapped buttons and special features just stop working. The driver has stopped working. You can restart the driver but by that time you've already been fragged. With out the drivers you have an adjustable mass paper weight. Perhaps a better name for his mouse would be Windvexer.
If you switch the mouse to use only it's onboard memory, which disables per-game tuning, it seems you can bypass the driver freaking out. This also confirms it's not switches or any mechanical issue. it's just bad software.
Logitech needs to drop the fancy graphics in the configuration screens and replace them with some functional code.

title: What a piece of trash
text: This is made in the cheapest fashion possible. Switches wore out after nine months of medium to light use and couldn't get a replacement. The features are decent, the software is frustrating, the ergonomics are ok only.

title: biggest glaring issue. might be me.
text: I love this mouse, and think it is an amazing mouse. the customizable weight set lets you balance it beautifully for a more tailored experience. The DPI settings are customizable for all 5 setpoints. There is just 1 issue I have with it and it might just be how I hold the mouse. Occassionally when I left click on the mouse it triggers the increase DPI mouseclick as well (I might also be hitting the button) so as you can imagine no matter what I'm doing I end up at max DPI settings.

title: Small
text: Way too small for a regular persons hand. I would work all day then game all evening and my hand would cramp. I ended up giving this to my child. Disappointed in Logitech recent years. I switched to a Corsair keyboard and mouse and haven't looked back yet. I still sport a Logitech cam and mouse pad.

title: JUNK - I do not recommend
text:
The mouse wheel on this mouse is terrible. Yeah, I know it has a lock/unlock button but even unlocked it doesnt work correctly. For example, while reading reviews, I had to scroll my wheel 5 times before it actually scrolled down to the next review.
Sometimes it will scroll on the first try, sometimes scrolling the wheel will cause my screen to go backwards.

As it stands, when scrolling through internet pages, I have to drag the browser bar because the mouse wheel is absolutely useless.

title: I love these mice!  I own 4 of them now.
text: I have 4 of these mice now.  Two on my gaming systems and one on each kids systems.  They are amazing and have lots of buttons to customize.

title: Great Mouse
text:
This is the best shaped mouse I've ever owned before. It fits in my hand really well. Very comfortable to use. And the weights add customization and ease of use to it.
I just wish it had more buttons on it. But I still really like the macros you can make the buttons that are on it.
Great product!

title: Durable, well built mouse!
text: This is an updated version of a very popular mouse! Excellent feel in my hand. Buttons are responsive and have a quiet but audible click. The whole mouse feels well built and the cable is flexible and durable.  The associated Logitech program is very useful with automatic profiles although I prefer to program the onboard mouse settings and set up keybinds in game.

title: Great mouse, very comfortable
text:
This is a great mouse. Feels great in the hand. Very solid and not hollow or flimsy.

Unfortunately it will not make you any better at Overwatch, but I won't deduct any stars for that

title: Disappointing
text: Unfortunately the mouse came USED not new as it was discribed on the order, The mouse itself is very good and comfortable but its so disappointing that the packaging was bad and the mouse had dust and scratches on the back and it was so clear that it was used by someone else..

title: Can't hold left click/double click issues cropped up right after the warranty expired.
text: The mouse is now unable to hold left click and sends multiple left click inputs instead. This issue started happening just over 2 years after I bought it which means its no longer in warranty and Logitech support bot told me to pound sand. Tried doing all the troubleshooting, but it appears other people have had this exact issue with this mouse. I would avoid. Oh, and Logitech starts counting the warranty when Amazon gets this mouse in stock, not when you get the mouse. Logitech showed that the warranty expired a year and a half after I bought it from Amazon even though it's supposed to be a 2 year warranty. Guessing it sat with Amazon for 6 months using up the warranty.

title: Can't hold left click/double click issues cropped up right after the warranty expired.
text: The mouse is now unable to hold left click and sends multiple left click inputs instead. This issue started happening just over 2 years after I bought it which means its no longer in warranty and Logitech support bot told me to pound sand. Tried doing all the troubleshooting, but it appears other people have had this exact issue with this mouse. I would avoid. Oh, and Logitech starts counting the warranty when Amazon gets this mouse in stock, not when you get the mouse. Logitech showed that the warranty expired a year and a half after I bought it from Amazon even though it's supposed to be a 2 year warranty. Guessing it sat with Amazon for 6 months using up the warranty.

title: Awesome mouse for the short window it lasts
text:
I loved the ergonomics and button position and weight of this mouse. Very smooth and the weight added heft which I enjoy.

Now I have purchased 3 of the G502 heros and they went like this: the first one died on me after a year of so but I was hard on it so I ordered a replacement. After about 1 year the replacement one suddenly had what I could only describe as a flutter in the right click button. If I held down the right button it wouldn't stay held it would turn off and on. A good description is when playing an FPS I would ADS and in the screen it would flicker the gun up and down over and over and not actually keep aiming down the sights in game it was as if I was manually rapid clicking the button; but I wasn't, I was holding it solid. The third one I bought because I figured that other one was a fluke freak... So the third one after about 6 months it did the exact same identical thing except on the left click button. Which makes dragging and dropping files on the pc impossible and makes highlights in word docs or excel docs impossible! So now I know it is a G502 hero issue I have had 3 and all lasted about a year to a year and a half and all just stopped functioning. The first just sometimes didn't seem to recognize clicks, the second the right click flickered, and the third the left click flickered.

I love the feel and weight so much! But the dang things don't last and I am not even a hardcore gamer. Maybe 8 to 12 hours a week at most (married and have 4 little kids, ain't got no time for heavy gaming)

title: Good mouse
text: Perfect mouse to me, the scroll wheels awesome. use the button underneath it that changes its function, try it out

title: Double Click!!!
text: I'm furious! I couldn't figure out why a game I was playing had weird behavior when dragging boxes (like you would on your desktop), I was convinced it was just the game or lag until I found out this mouse has a known double-click issue! Multiple clicks even. I put up with this for so long, I don't know why. I was ready to buy another one, it's even on sale, but apparently many people report having this issue. I wouldn't rate 1 star if this was an isolated issue, but it doesn't seem to be at all.

title: Excellent quality!
text: You can't go wrong with this brand or Seller!

title: good weight
text: for gaming its best

title: Pretty good. Not as big as other mice.
text: People who like flatter wider mice to rest their hand on should look elsewhere.

title: Worthy Successor to my MX518
text:
Got it to replace my MX518 that died. I thought about getting another one but figured after using a MX510 MX512 MX518 since 1999 I would try something else.

This feels a lot like the MX5x series, but more refined. Also has more buttons.
The software is intiutive and doesn't feel bloated. Has everything you need to control RGB, DPI and other settings.

Glides effortlessly on the mousepad. I love the option of customizeable weights.

Highly recommend for this price range.

title: Amazing performance
text: You cannot go wrong with this mouse if you are used to a bit heavy mice. Allows varying dpi's adjustable as per your requirements. Extra buttons on the mouse for back and forward functions. And additional clickable keys on the side for gaming. Using it for csgo and looks cool with its rgb. My favorite is the scroll as its quite accurate compared my old mouse was quite irritating.

title: Great Mouse
text:
Got this mouse because of a recommendation from a friend. He uses it for everything from MMOs to FPS games.

The mouse feels great in the hand and all of the programable buttons are easy to reach. It also has additional weights to get your desired amount of drag resistance.

The build quality seems pretty good. The scroll wheel is solid, the cable is braided, and the buttons all have a good feel to them.

The Logitech software is very good for setting up macros, mapping buttons, changing RGB settings, etc.

Overall it seems like a great mouse for the price.

title: FURIOUS WITH THE LEFT CLICK PROBLEM
text:
The web blogs are true. There is a left click problem with this one. Sometimes it doesn't even work. You have to use it in combination with the right click button. Not consistent! My $10 mouse is still reliable. So disappointed.

Maybe it really is for a gaming pc only, not for use with a mini pc.

title: Great Mouse for the price
text: Awesome mouse can't complain I just don't understand why I don't win every single game I play effortlessly now, I wonder if it a me problem...

title: This is a Multi-Functional Programmable Gaming Mouse!
text: I've never seen a Mouse so versatile, innovative, and multi-functional. It's absolutely amazing what my son has been able to program and perform with this Mouse!! High Quality and Very Durable!

title: No complaints. Works as it says.
text: Son loves all things it can do. I used it once when I needed to borrow his pc and it was comfortable and I have small hands. He says it’s comfortable and has much bigger hands. It has a lot of options like weights you can add to the bottom if you want a heavier mouse. I just need a mouse that I can point and click. Can’t elaborate on the functions but I can promise if they DIDNT work I would know. He can be picky.  Not a single complaint about this mouse.

title: Feet hell
text: Great customizable mouse, never had issues with double click and I've had it for 2-3 years. However, the feet are godawful. Dust, crumbs, everything gets stuck in the sides between the feet and the mouse. Eventually you'll have to replace the feet because they'll start to lift off, and it will be a giant pain. I've gone through several different brands of replacement feet and they all have the same issues: cut too big, cut too small, peel off, not thick enough. They will grind on the mouse pad and you may never experience smooth movement ever again.

title: Scroll wheel free wheels tooooo much!
text:
I bought this Logitech G502 HERO High Performance Wired Gaming Mouse to prevent wireless connection lag. My wireless mouse (although better than this one) had intermittent lag. Occasionally, the mouse pointer would stop moving. I thought a wired gaming mouse would have a better connection.

There are some good points to this gaming mouse. The dpi is very high so just a small movement of the mouse would all the pointer to go clear across the screen. The bad is the mouse wheel. There is no friction on the wheel so when you scroll or roll the wheel it just keeps going. Than means you have to keep your finger on the wheel to stop it. Also, every time I use the wheel and let it go, the page jumps around. Sometimes up or down. VERY ANNOYING!

I cannot recommend using this mouse, I'll have to look for another wired mouse that doesn't have this annoying feature.

title: Skip it
text: It's just not comfortable.  I've used many mouses since the 90s and this is one of the least comfortable I've touched.  You can't easily do the lift, it doesn't work well on many surfaces.  Just a bad mouse all around.

title: The click is too light.
text: My middle finger constantly clicks the right mouse button and it’s very frustrating, I want a heavier mouse (more weights) with heavier buttons please, they’re too delicate :(

title: Great Form, Horrible Defect
text:
If you bought this mouse and it started having a clicking issue (clicks don't hold, double clicking on a single click, not registering a click) IT IS NOT A UNIT DEFECT! This is a wide spread defect on this model. It works fine for 1-3 months, then the switch starts to wear out. I've seen countless posts and reviews commenting on this and still giving it 4-5 stars, claiming it was just a single unit defect and acting like the model defect is fine.

It does have nice ergonomics, and the extra buttons are handy for gaming, but I can't in good conscience recommend this model to anyone. Any time I need to do anything more than a single click or a double click I find myself wishing that I had bought a different mouse. Holding the mouse button for anything; shooters, minecraft, dragging windows, selecting cells; it's all nearly impossible! The mouse constantly glitches out and resets the click, which at best is annoying, and at worst is destructive.

title: The Best Mouse All Around
text: I loved this product! I initially bought this for gaming, but now it’s just my regular mouse. Somehow it makes even doing my schoolwork easier—? I love the programmable 11 buttons! It’s very useful! I love the adjustable weights, but personally so keep all weights in my mouse for the heaviest/most weighted. I will100% be buying this for my friends as gifts or something! I just wanna share this with them, because this mouse is the best!

title: Good successor for G700s users
text: It's one of the better mice they've released in the last two years.

title: I like it.
text: Using it for CAD operation.

title: Big mouse and cheaply made
text: This is not for people with small hands at all. My mouse would not actuate the click because of poor quality control on the moldings so gaming was horrific and holding Left Mouse button down is nearly impossible. I highly recommend another brand of mouse if you are a woman or a small handed person or require holding a left mouse button to work with. I give it a "Do Not Buy" rating when an Off Brand has better quality control.

title: Fantastic mouse for multibuttoned gaming.
text: Fantastic mouse for multibuttoned gaming.

title: Double click - Be warned!
text: Loved this mouse for 3 months, absolutely everything. Then one day it started to randomly double click on the right mouse button, but only maybe once per 1,000 clicks, no big deal right? Wrong. This escalates and quickly becomes to 1 in every 10 clicks just a month after you notice the first double click issue starting. Being a "gaming mouse", and a reputable company, I expected more. I took the time to write the review now because after 4 months with my right click double clicking every 1 out of 10 clicks the left mouse button has started the 1 out of 1,000. My fear is that in another month I'll have the same issue with the left click. This mouse is already un-usable for gaming as any fps with scopes become unplayable as you cannot reliably ADS or hold scopes in fear that it will double click and make you lose ADS or lose your scope.

title: Awesome!
text: Good mouse! One tip though: the mouse did not work correctly with my old mousepad. Apparently this mouse is a little picky with them. Had to buy a new mouse pad and now it is more than fine.

title: An absolute joy to use
text: When I first had seen this mouse - and the special edition version which is uglier and $15 cheaper right now - I thought it looked extra and ridiculous between the multicolor LED and the weird design and the thumb-rest wing type thing on the side. I literally ONLY bought this because the multi-tilt scroll-wheel on my G500S was broken and the mouse was 3 years old so I believe out of warranty. That said, it's been smooth as butter from the beginning. It does require a newer version of the LGS than older peripherals did, but installing it didn't mess up my G933 or G810 profiles at all - something you should expect but these days you can't. The mouse has good weight without the custom weights - which like all Logitech gaming mice come in their own separate case and can be mixed and matched. Unlike the MX517, G500, and other previous lines, there is no weight tray - it's built in to the bottom of the mouse. Just life the panel on the bottom. I personally am not using them. This unit definitely has the precision, out of the box, for Photoshop work as well. Gaming I honestly haven't noticed a huge improvement but it has stayed the same, and that's all I needed. The scroll wheel has the same two modes as the G500 - theres a loud clicky mode with more traction, and a quiet smoother mode for faster scrolling. As with other Logitech gaming products, you can turn the LED off completely, or sync it with the LEDs from your other devices. I love it and it was on sale for maybe $50 or so, to be honest I don't remember the price because it was low.

title: Good mouse
text: I dont care about all the bells and whistles, just tired of buying cheap mice that crap out after a year and this is still working.

title: Great mouse
text: Great mouse for everyday work of gaming. My teenage son is very happy. This will last long time, better spend money to get good quality than keep buying cheap product.

title: Mouse jesus
text: I'll always be faithful to the g502

title: Love this!!!
text: Absolutely, love this mouse. I don’t really game but the faster settings helps me complete work for my job quicker. I can take test faster too. My husband has one for gaming and he loves it for gaming. The keys lock for scrolling and unlock. It has color choices.  I added a few weighs to mine which comes with it!!! Love this mouse!

title: Before I even receive it, I know what to expect.
text:
Call this a preview before trying it.
See I've been using the G402 now for years. I don't remember what mine in front of me was but I know it wasn't "Hero".

Pros:
The button layout is outstanding, I usually don't like to mess with my DPI setting on the fly, so I change those buttons to numbers. So I have 1-8 programmed into the various buttons you can use. If this had one more programmable button it would be perfect and if a representative from Logitech is listening, Give us a ring ringer button. Trust me, we will adapt to using the finger, it might start out using the 9th position but hey its there.

The only reason I'm buying a new one is I've worn the scroll wheel out so bad, I'm relegated to dragging pages instead most of the time.

Cons:

I swear the designer has girly hands. I have big hands and holding onto this thing for hours can leave your hand exhausted and crampy. I get you have to make it so everyone can use it but we are just talking mainly the shell, would it be that expensive to have a big hand version?

Still:

It has the best layout of buttons for gaming I've every used.

title: Great Gaming Mouse/Everyday Mouse
text: Works great the sensor is precise enough to get me the snaps I need in game

title: NOT COMPATIBLE WITH MAC
text: On new Macs this will be identified as a keyboard and won't work.  It will literally work as a mouse but that's it; software can't bind keys.  I spent a LONG time with Logitech confirming this.  Don't buy.

title: Simply the best gaming mouse.

title: Nice mouse, doubleclick problem after 2.5 years
text: Very nice, comfortable mouse. I'm a software engineer, not a gamer, so I can't speak to the gaming aspect of it, but I like pretty much everything about the mouse, especially how configurable all the buttons are. One con is that after 2.5 years it developed a double-click issue (clicking the left button once often results in a double-click.) Not the biggest deal, but still disappointing.

title: feels very small in hand

i find myself pressing wrong buttons all the time
fits better people with small palm

title: Good ergonomic shape for larger hands
text: The shape and feel of the mouse is nice, and comfortable for people with larger hands. The custom button placements are better than the older models and easier to hit. The one issue I have is why did you make the scroller button out of Teflon? It's seriously the slipperiest roller on any mouse I've ever used; the last one had a nice rubber strip around it. Hopefully as it wears it will lose some of this but I may have to disassemble it and buff it up a bit so I can roll it without accidentally clicking all the time. You can turn off the clicker so that it's a smooth scroll but that's very sensitive to backwards scrolls so is hard to use in normal situations like web browsing, etc.

title: Terrible software
text: Great mouse. Worst software in the world. Logitech is known for crap software but their latest version redefines stupid. If you enjoy being thoroughly frustrated then by all means go for it but their entire management should be fired for releasing this into the wild.

title: Surprisingly wonderful Logitech product
text: I have stayed away from Logitech for over 10 years. Everything I have owned of theirs would break so fast. This mouse has been amazing. It feels good. The app works well so you can macro it. And you can write Lua scripts for it using Logitech’s API.

title: Ergonomic, hyper scroll feature
text: Highly suggested. Reasonable price. On board memory. Wired so no battery or lad issue. Hyper-scrolling is a great feature. Some people had problems with left click but I haven't had a problem for nearly a year.

title: Very good garbage
text: It's a solid mouse and well built, comes with all the bells and whistles you'd expect in a mouse... except the click detector is all the way in the base at the top of the mouse, making it extremely finicky and unreliable. I've had several instances using the mouse where I'd be holding down left or right, and the mouse wouldn't detect that I was holding, and would even "click" while I was still holding the mouse down. To get consistent results, I'd have to click at the very top of the button. This mouse is utterly unreliable, and I'm sorely disappointed.

title: Insanely Good mouse
text: Get this. end of the story. If I had a bigger budget I would've got the wireless one. This is an incredibly comfortable mouse. Great customization. Super responsive. Only thing is that the GHub software doesn't recognize minecraft. Other than that I have no complaints.

title: Another double clicking mice

title: Logitech THE BEST

Logitech g hub is perfect for what the mouse can be upgraded to. The mouse itself is phenomenal. Nothing to complain about. Family mouse... gamers mouse... work mouse ANYTHING YOU SET IT UP TO DO, IT WILL DO IT IN STYLE

title: Excellent mouse!
text: I used the same Lachesis for over 13 years and was nervous about trying a new mouse. This thing is amazing! 25,000+ DPI, excellent ergonomics, plenty of buttons... what's not to like? I'm not a huge person but it fits my hand just fine and I really like the thumb rest. The metal mouse wheel has a great feel, it's not at all slippery and completely necessary to take advantage of the infinite scroll feature. The adjustable weights are also a nice feature. Grab this mouse, it's worth every penny!

title: Nice upgrade from the old G402
text: I replaced my old G402 mouse with this, and am extremely happy with my purchase so far. The mouse comfortably fits my hand, the buttons are easy to reach/use. The adjustable weight is a nice touch, as I can weight the mouse to my preference for a heavier feel. The RGB can be turned off, which I like. 16,000 DPI is probably overkill, but it's great to never feel like I need more DPI than the mouse can provide

title: Good gaming mouse

title: Mouse came broken. Lighting on the logo doesn't even work
text: Broken upon arrival

title: Not My Favorite - Mouse Too Big for S/M Hands
text:
As a girl, I never thought I'd worry about the size of my hands... but it's important when choosing a gaming mouse. I bought this as a lightning deal for $39. So, 40 bucks is a fair price point for this mouse - a separate software download from the internet makes it completely customizable to your liking. This is both a pro and con b/c 1) I hate bloatware from an internet download and 2) I can spend hours setting it up when I'd rather be gaming. The weights that come with it are nice quality.

The regular price is somewhere around $60-$70... I'd say forget that! Pros include weights you can add/subtract, DPI options, and LED lights with option to sync with other Logitech products. Cons: Too big for my hand, lack of control b/c of overall size.

PS I learned after my purchase there is a mid-size version of this mouse.

title: Solid upgrade from G500s
text:
Upgraded to this from a G500s. I wasn’t sure if I’d like the DPI shift button or not, and figured I’d just re-bind it to another function, but I actually like it. I wish this had one more thumb button, as I tend to bind this to the “inventory” of the games I play.
The cable is super flexible, so it doesn’t “spring” the mouse when you let go of it, like my old mouse occasionally did.
The mouse works with G Hub for programming macros and such, which is miles ahead of the Logitech gaming software in terms of creating macros and other keybinds.
The mouse has a decent weight to it without using the supplied weights, but that’s personal preference. The mode wheel is a little too stiff for my liking, it really ka-chunk ka-chunks into the detents.
I have rather large hands and it fits nice in my hand. All of the buttons are reachable for me.

title: Husband is happy!
text: Husband's only complaint is he can't figure out how to set up the On Board Memory with this mouse. He hasn't really looked into and will end up getting his brother to help him set it up but he's over all content with the mouse and use of it :)

title: Awesome product

title: RGB, Fit, programmable buttons

The ability to adjust the weights underneath the mouse make it great for each individual user.100x over again I would purchase this mouse. title: made for larger hands, broke after a year
text: Normally I love Logitech brand, but you should skip this one. Build quality, it’s not up to par. Scroll wheel stopped working and mouse started to drift upwards on its own after only a year of ownership. I'm not rough with my mouse and keyboard so this was a disappointing purchase. title: Loved the programmed buttons!!!!
text: So I had to do a lot of repetitive entries, and I just programmed the buttons. Easy as pie. This is maki g the dull tasks fun and super easy. No more typing. Awesome mouse, love it. Sorry. I’m not a gamer, so I can’t get you that feedback, but it’s fully programmable with selective profiles, very flexible.

title: Good substitute for my razer deathadder elite
text: Some of the buttons on my razer mouse stopped working.  The logitech replaced it.  I'm not a gamer so I can't comment on that.  The logitech feels good but I still need to get adjusted to it.  The price was also better than the razer.

title: Best mouse I've ever owned, until it broke within a few months
text:
This is absolutely the best mouse that I've ever owned. But you need to understand that the issues mentioned in review after review are correct and widespread. If Logitech were to actually fix these issues, they'd likely have about 99% of the market.

The issue for mine occurred in the right button and involved double clicks/the button not recognizing being held. It was a hardware issue, not a software one as I had a separate Logitech to test the software. The mouse button was even tested on two computers as well.

The same issue has just started to pop up for a friend as well with their system. Double clicks/phantom presses/non-consistent presses.

Save yourself the aggravation and find a more reliable mouse, even if this one will be the best one you'll ever have (until issues pop up). I guess this is why the G502 has been taken off quite a few updated mouse buying guides.

title: Very smooth
text: Works well for gaming. The weights that it comes with really help.

title: Good mouse
text: Great feel, great customization options. Overall very happy with this purchase.

title: Works nice
text: Nice corded mouse for gaming and everyday use.

title: Favorite mouse ever!
text: I have been PC gaming for over 20 years now ( yes I started with DOOM and Duke Nukem) and have used many different mouses.  My last mouse was a red Dragon gamming mouse and I thought I loved it.  Then I got the Logitech G502 Hero and wow.  I now have a favorite mouse of all time.  I have larger hands and it fits great, I love that I can add all the weights.  The buttons are just in the right place for my fingers and thumb, it feels natural when using.  My fault completely but one month in I had to get a new cord.  I found a para cord replacement online for $12.  It was easy to replace and now I am back in the game.

title: FAULTY CLICK SENSOR
text:
[[VIDEOID:638ca4cf400b89f35e72a96f67c1e86d]] For the first year this mouse was truly fantastic, would have whole-heartedly given it 5 stars, however after only a single year I have encountered a problem that renders the mouse nigh unusable.
After only a single year, the primary button, m1, suffers from severe stuttering and unreliable response from user inputs.
It is utterly ridiculous for a mouse at this price point to suffer from a hardware flaw like this so soon, and apparently it is a common issue with many other logitech brand mice.

Trying to navigate through the Logitech warranty website is a purposefully roundabout experience in order to do anything except give you a replacement under their own warranty policy. This is made increasingly more aggravating by attempting to fight your way through their site with a busted mouse. Needless to say I am very disappointed in my purchase and will be avoiding Logitech for any future hardware needs.

title: Same Great G502 Now With an Even Better Sensor
text: What can I say that hasn't already been said, the G502 is a fantastic mouse and has been a fantastic mouse since it originally launched now it has a 16000 dpi sensor, its only getting better. Overall if you need a gaming mouse buy this, it's one of the best general purpose gaming mice on the market and is quite comfortable to boot.

title: Gamer, mouse broke, omg so many choices... but made the right one
text: Though the look didnt originally captivate me its really come to grow on me. The feel is excellent. Action is smooth ( I used the weights). Plenty of programmable buttons and a light util you can download for free. The scroll wheel (when you release the brake) feels like its got a fidget spinner bearing in there, weeeee, that thing spins crazy fast/long. Anyway, im very satisfied by this mouse, and its price. Never been disappointed with Logitech so im not too surprised. GG Logitech, thanks!

title: I was surprised by the quality.
text: I don't know how else to say it but this mouse is awesome especially if you have big hands like me. I got this mouse as a replacement/holder until I got my corsair mouse back from a replacement I had to make due to a button failing on it (right click). I wanted something that had the same similar style with enough buttons for my MMO games and a thumb rest. Long story short, I thought for 40 bucks I was getting a cheaper quality mouse compared to my other one. Instead I received a great quality mouse that felt better in my hand and even shocked me with its great remapping software. The integrated games mapping is awesome. Before I had to go into a game and find the mapping to make a profile on my mouse and remap that to whatever button I wanted. With the Logitech software it scans the games and tells you exactly what mappings do what. It's kind of hard to explain but it makes things so much easier! If you try this out you'll see what I mean. Little things like that and the actual quality build of the mouse is why I'm switching from my 90$ mouse to a 40$ mouse as my go to.

title: Excellent mouse, would like a larger version.
text: The mouse works as advertised, quality product. I would like this exact mouse for a larger hand though. I accidentally hit the buttons on the side, because I have large hands. I can palm a basketball with no problem for example. Aside from that, no problems.

title: Good hardware, seriously awful software
text:
The mouse feels great, just like my 6 year old g502 that finally bit the bullet on me. Good weight, good cable, scrolling and buttons all feel good.

The one huge giant issue I've already run into in my first week of owning it is the new version of the horrible "G HUB" software. It constantly ignores my profile and button assignments. I have the mouse set to use 400 dpi with all profile switching and DPI switching buttons disabled. At least once a day I need to un plug and re plug in my mouse as it seems to go to the default 1200 dpi, and ignores all my configured buttons. This alone really makes the mouse feel like a huge pain in the butt, and a real step down from the previous model. I hope this gets fixed in the near future, because I don't see myself sticking out with these annoying problems for another 5 years.

title: Nice corded mouse, lots of options for hobbyist graphic artist
text: The adjustable weights help create the right 'feel' and physical responsiveness, the G-hub software lets me turn off the silly lights so they're not distracting/annoying. Lots of buttons for multiple uses that don't involve gaming. Adjustable DIP fantastic for Photoshop and large scale graphics. It's wired, so there's no batteries to worry about, and the really long cord means little/no resistance when using with mini-tower graphics rig. This is an A+ mouse.

title: Would recommend
text: Bought this for my son who is a big gamer. He picked it out, I bought it, and he's been happy with it so I guess based on that, I would recommend.

title: The Best Mouse
text: The overall best mouse I have ever had. Eventually everything wears out, and it's being replaced with the same model. If you are into gaming, you set up your keys the way you want, depending on the game. For general use, it is comfortable, smooth operating. Highly recommended.

title: Decent mouse for the money
text:
A decent mouse for the money, lots of buttons. For normal computer use, it's outstanding.
My one complaint with it applies to every single gaming mouse I've ever used: the mouse wheel doesn't have enough resistance, so when you use it as a button while gaming, it tends to roll forward or backward too, which has unintended consequences in 99% of games. It'd be nice if just ONE manufacturer made a stiffer wheel, or a special lock button for it.

title: It is good while it works but it won't last long.
text: It is good while it works but this thing develop click and drag issue. Whatever, I click and drag on windows screen, it let go of it and mess up my files. It happened countless times and because of this malfunction, I dragged files to random location so many times. At first, I though this happened because I used this mouse for too long. Well.. time to get new one. Problem solved. Then, I checked my purchase history. I bought this same mouse for 4 times already in past 3 years. Sometimes it lasted an year, some times it lasted less than 6 months. Wow.. is this coincident? So I checked online and so many people had same issue. When this is not just my problem, then there is design issue or quality control issue. Maybe they made it to fail after certain period of time to make customer to buy it again. Shame on them. Whatever the case, I will not buy this brand ever again. Yes, I tried their troubleshooting, updating firmware, software blah blah but nothing works until you buy new one.

title: good

title: Mine arrived broken
text: Not a fan of buying “gamer” products, but this was was just plain broken because of the over engineering that went into the mouse wheel (MB3).

title: Will probably break within a year
text: I have had multiple of these mice, not because I bought them, but because they keep breaking.  I actually got upgraded to this model after they stopped producing the old one and mine broke. I appreciate that they are willing to replace the broken ones, but all of these have broken in the same way.  I never slam my mouse, or do anything that justifies it breaking, but after a while, the sensor just starts bugging out.  DPI will seem to randomly change, or the mouse acts like the sensor is cutting in and out at random.  This is not what you want happening when you're playing a game, or at all for that matter.  I clean the sensor and try different mousepad surfaces, but they all eventually started doing this.  I don't know if their replacement program sends ones from worse manufacturers, or if it's just bad luck, but I cannot recommend this to anyone unless you want to go through Logitech support once every year or so to get a replacement when this breaks.

title: Came without the weights and looks used!
text:
Are you kidding me?? It came without the weights!! Like, it's one of the main features of this mouse and it came without them!! And on top of that it looks used! I can totally tell by the bottom glides! Come on man! >:(

Review update: I just researched a bit more and I can now confirm that it is a used mouse. I watch an unboxing video and it's supposed to come with a semi hard plastic wrap protection AND THE MANUAL of course, guess what, mine didn'tcome with any of that, it was just the bare mouse inside the box. Complete scam!

title: wasn't for me
text: Could just be me but I didn't like this mouse. After my son loaded some crazy setup in the memory it started acting up. When I finally figured out how to use the software to clear the internal memory it would work normally again but then any other pc I plugged it into started having the same crazy problem(constant backspace). that would require another mouse to be able to download the software and set it to clear the internal memory to get it to work right again. The mouse wheel was either to tight or if I used the free wheel it was to loose. After fiddling with it I finally just threw it in the trash and replaced it with a $20 mouse.

text: Initially I received a used mouse, but the replacement one arrived quickly and works great. This is a bulky mouse for sure, but it's ergonomic, smooth as glass, and comfy. The scroll wheel lock is an awesome feature, and while the locked-wheel is a bit more clunky than I'd like, the unlocked wheel rolls around with ease. Such a nice feature. I also like the fact that this mouse isn't COVERED in the RGB-gamer-aesthetic too, you don't even have to use Logitech's spyware software, this mouse works right out of the box!

title: Solid Gaming Mouse
text:
I’ve read a lot of reviews where people complain about a double clicking issue or uncomfortable button locations and stuff so I thought I’d share my thoughts.

I got it a week ago and so far I’ve experienced zero issues with it whatsoever but the double clicking problem usually doesn’t develop until later so if it does come up eventually, I will update my review.

The sensor is this mouse is legit, one of the best I’ve ever come across and I’ve used a lot of gaming mice in my life. From Razer to Alienware, this one competes with the best of them. The adjustable weights are also a plus. I’m not hardcore on FPS so I don’t use them but they can come in handy for those of you who are into shooters. The extra buttons are also a big plus. It has a couple and they can be very useful.

The only downside I can think of is the mouse itself is rather a bit small for my taste and I think it could use a pinky support but I do have large hands so perhaps it isn’t applicable for everyone. Also while it does have many extra buttons, the thumb one is awkwardly positioned right under the thumb so I frequently press it by mistake. The two index finger buttons next to left click are also a bit inconvenient because one would have to move the index finger off the important left click to use them.

Conclusion: I got it on sale for $39.99 and for the price it’s a fantastic deal. At its full price of $80 however they may be better options but either way, it is a solid product.

title: Didn't last long
text:
I have had this mouse for almost a year and a half and am now experiencing an issue where single clicking results in multiple clicks on my left mouse button. It won't stay pressed which makes highlighting text and dragging across the screen impossible and infuriating. This is not the first time I've had issues with Logitech mice. Will not be purchasing them ever again.

Positives: Comfortable to hold, weighty, nice to the touch, cool lights, lots of features. If it didn't have this issue, this would be a 5 star product.

title: If you use Logitech Gaming Software (LGS), All settings for all devices will be lost
text:
Update: After uninstalling G Hub and reinstalling LGS the mouse is now recognized in LGS. While I have read elsewhere that it is not supported on LGS, it is working so I've added another star. So far the mouse itself is good, the software situation is still a mess.

---

If you used Logitech Gaming Software before, expect to start all customization from scratch for all your logitech devices.

Logitech Gaming Software (LGS) does not recognize this mouse. It requires different software (G Hub) which also requires uninstalling LGS.

With G Hub, the company trashed working and mature software (LGS) in favor of non-functional or barely functional beta software. After figuring out how to fix the infinite loading loop, you will still have to start over remaking all customizations and macros for all software. There is no working capability to import LGS profiles to GHUB and no option to do this manually due to core design format changes.

title: So far so good
text:
We know the DPI settings and all that is gonna be good, it's Logitech. There are so many buttons and settings to mess around with the DPI, to be honest I still haven't figured it all out.

I am glad that braided cords is the standard now, I remember a time when it was a new and high-end thing.

The best thing about this mouse for me is the size and shape of it. I'm definitely a palm-gripper and this thing fits my hand so perfectly and the clicks respond exactly how I want them to. The question is if this will last me more than a year or two.

The ability to change the weight and the center of gravity of the mouse is also pleasant. What's off-putting about a lot of the gaming mice is if it feels too light or flimsy, but they really hit the nail with the adjustable weights.

title: Sensor tracking issues
text:
I am having tracking issues with mine. It's mainly my table to blame, but my Razor mouse don't have a problem with my desk and mouse pad. The software does not allow me to calibrate my sensor for my mouse pad nor does it let me adjust the lift off distance like Razor software can.

My table is plastic table and the weight of my pc and monitor bow the middle of the my table causing a sunk in effect. My table also has ripples / waves you can feel with your hand when you slide across. The mouse pad I have hides the ripples to some degree. So this mouse not taking a liking to this and thus not working out for me.

But when using it, you can feel it hang on something and stop moving for a sec. My Razor mouse does not have any issue. You can glide my Razor mouse across gravel and it still make head shots. But this mouse not working for me.

title: LOGITECH has FALLEN OFF. DO NOT BUY THIS.
text:
DO NOT BELIEVE ANY OF THE GOOD REVIEWS ON THIS MOUSE.

Logitech is known for making high quality products, so the assumption is that this mouse will be worth buying. If you're looking at this mouse, then you already know the specs. However, you need to go online and on Youtube and search for "LOGITECH G2 HERO DOUBLE CLICK ISSUE". Once you do, you will find that this mouse has a serious design and quality flaw. The mouse's left button will begin to double click, by itself, uncontrollably and intermittently. And it gets worse over time, to the point that you can do no work, or play, with the mouse. It becomes unreliable to select, copy, or do any precision clicking.

NO TECH SUPPORT FROM LOGITECH
So... Logitech took down its phone line and only interacts via email. They say that its due to covid 19 - but we're in October... other companies have figured out how to adjust. Apparently, Logitech has not. If they were attentive, that would be okay. They are not. When you contact them for this mouse - and you will , once the double clicking starts - they will ask you for A CRAP TON of information, and make you record video of you troubleshooting your own mouse, and emailing them links to your video. THEN, they will take over a week to respond.. with another REQUEST for more trouble shooting videos.

They will go back and forth with you for a month - and only 1 email a week, and then stop responding.

I had to file a complaint with my state consumer protection division, and post the complaint on their Facebook page, before SUDDENLY they sent me a replacement mouse. So all was fixed right?

WRONG. The second mouse has the same double clicking issue, which manifested within 2 weeks of use. The previous mouse lasted 5 months before the double clicking got so bad that I first contacted Logitech.

VERDICT
Do not buy this mouse. Watch the videos. Search out the complaints about Logitech's tech support. My experience was not unique, nor is the double clicking problem. I am giving Logitech products a wide berth now, no matter what bells and whistles they have, because of the HORRENDOUS tech support. I solved my own problem by buying a replacement Redragon brand mouse - a cheaper brand that will AT LEAST last longer than 2 weeks or 5 months. It's so sad to see a good company go down the tubes.

I uploaded pictures of my double click error test with my NEW REPLACEMENT mouse. 18 errors in 204 clicks, and that was my BEST result. This mouse is TRASH, and all the good reviews are likely from new purchases, when the mouse is still working and fine. Wait a few weeks or months.

title: Close to perfection
text:
I've used Logitech products since I was in middle school (I'm around 30 now) so I know this company has had time to work through what makes a good mouse. The texturized feel (I'm a sucker for grippy textures), the sleek look, the hyper scroll option, the "sniper" button, the braided cable, switching DPI settings on the fly (with lighting to indicate the current DPI setting), changing the weight and this many programmable G-keys are all in one, reasonably priced, package.

Could we ask for more? Sure, it could have more G-keys, more RGB lighting, and lighting settings, be lighter and more ergonomic, but this is the gaming mouse for me. I do wish the wireless version wasn't an extra $100 with a $100 charging mousepad, but if I were made of money, I would have just bought all that instead. That's a small compromise considering that you can get this mouse for $30 - $50 on sale - considering the quality of this mouse - that's an insane deal. Go for it.

title: Great Mouse For Limited Time
text:
Have gone through two of these mice already and same issue both times. After about a year the mouse will cause the camera to look straight up and the M2 (right click) button completely gives out. Good luck playing any FPS game without rage quitting when this inevitably occurs.

Its disappointing because brand new, the G520 Hero is a great gaming mouse. It fits nicely in the hand, has adjustable weights, and the perfect number of buttons for most gaming styles. Would love to purchase another but can not justify throwing more money at Logitech for a product I know will fail within a year.

title: Logitech doesn't honor their warranty, THIS MOUSE HAS A MANUFACTURE DEFECT DO NOT BUY
text:
If you google "Logitech Double Clicking issues" this mouse is at the top of the problem. Logitech knows this, and instead of fixing the problem they make it impossible to return. Even if you get a replacement, it has the exact same issue. GARBAGE.

*The issue is caused by a faulty OMRON switch that handles registering the clicking of a button, the best solution is to buy a Blackwidow V2 as they have an optical sensor instead of a physical one.*

title: Hands down the best budget productivity mouse
text:
This is hands-down the best budget productivity mouse. I’m an avid gamer and I will not be using this for games. It’s just too heavy. However, I chose not to return it and instead use it for all of my non-gaming activities. The mouse wheel is phenomenal. The mouse feet were horrendous so I got a set of core pads for it. Putting them on was easy, no complaints. I didn’t feel the need to put any grip tape on it for lift off or anything like that. Its normal curvature and rubberized sides were fine for that purpose. I highly recommend this mouse for productivity, but I do not recommend it for gaming at all.

Wheel: S class
Skates: bandaid class
Build quality: A class
Everything else, clicks, etc: B

Fantastic for cheap!
